question: If <katex>$f(x)$</katex> and <katex>$g(x)$</katex> are two functions with <katex>$g(x)=x-\frac{1}{x}$</katex> and <katex>$fog(x)=x^{3}-\frac{1}{x^{3}}$</katex> then <katex>$f'(x)=$</katex>
explanation: Given <katex>$f(g(x)) = x^3 - 1/x^3$</katex>, we can write <katex>$f(u) = u^3 + 3u$</katex> where <katex>$u = g(x)$</katex>.
